patterns: what are the branches offered by your college
responses:
the branches offered in our college are
 1.CSE 
 2.ISE 
 3.ECE 
 4.ME 
 5.EEE 
 6.CE

patterns: tell me something about the college?
responses: Rao Bahadur Y. Mahabaleswarappa Engineering College,[Formerly Vijayanagar Engineering College] aims to enhance the knowledge and skill of the student in the filed of technology and engineering by grooming the students in all theoretical and practical aspects and contribute significantly towards creation of strong technical workforce that would bridge the gap between industry requirements and academic orientation.

patterns: what is the eligibility to join the college?
am i eligible to your college?
what is the percentage to be eligible to the college
what is minimum required percent to join college?
responses:
the Eligibility Criteria are:
1.12th:45%(general)
2.12th:40%( SC, ST, Category I and OBC (2A, 2B, 3A and 3B) Category candidates)

patterns: what are the documents for the admission procedure
documents to submit after seat allotment
responses:
THE DOCUMENTS TO GIVE AFTER GETTING CEAT FOR UNDERGRADUATE (REGULAR):
Admission Order (College copy).
Amount Paid Challan (College copy).
SSLC Original Marks Card.
PUC / XII Std. Original Marks Card.
PUC / XII Std. Transfer Certificate.
Study Certificates from I Std. to PUC.
Caste & Income Certificate (If applicable).
371J Hyderabad Karnataka Eligibility Certificate (If applicable).
Aadhaar Card.
Photo.
One Set Original & Three Sets Xerox in the above order.

patterns: what kind of scholarship do we get
responses:
Facilities have been given under different schemes. –

Candidates belonging to groups SC/ST – Govt. of India.
Candidates belonging to groups Cat 1/2A/2B – Govt. of Karnataka (Fee Concession).
Candidates belonging to groups Ex-servicemen Category – Govt. of India.
Scholarships will be given to meritorious students by Jindal Welfare Trust.
Scholarships given by Teachers Association to their children pursing education in engineering.
Scholarship by Minority Community to Minority students.
